definition: lit. money will make the Devil turn millstones (idiom)/fig. with money, you can do anything you like
pinyin: you3 qian2 neng2 shi3 gui3 tui1 mo4

definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: Money can move even the gods.

sentences.chinese: 別忘了，有錢能使鬼推磨。

sentences.english: There is a saying that goes, “money makes a mare go.”
sentences.chinese: 俗話說，“有錢能使鬼推磨。”

sentences.english: "Money talks" could not be applied to every situation.
sentences.chinese: “有錢能使鬼推磨”不能適用於所有場合。

sentences.english: Money makes the mare go. You can secure your ends with one hundred pounds.
sentences.chinese: 有錢能使鬼推磨，用一百英鎊你就能達到目的。

sentences.english: Money talks, but sometimes it needs an interpreter.
sentences.chinese: 有錢能使鬼推磨，但有時需要一個傳話筒。

sentences.english: 'Money talks, and people walk, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，有錢能使鬼推磨，沒錢則寸步難行。

sentences.english: Gold is the great magician of earth-it realises our dreams.
sentences.chinese: 有錢能使鬼推磨，錢財能實現我們的夢想。

sentences.english: Money can buy the devil himself.
